Le Monde enters Gaza City, an ocean of ruins emptied of its people
byline: By Luc Bronner (Gaza City, special correspondent)
subhed: Le Monde's Jerusalem correspondent entered the Palestinian urban area for a few hours on Friday, October 3, under escort from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). The territory, largely destroyed by airstrikes and bulldozers, was utterly deserted, with nearly all residents having fled south within the enclave.

US federal agent shoots Chicago motorist as protests spread, while a judge blocks troops to Portland
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Georgia's ruling party wins local polls as mass protests flare
subhed: The ruling, populist Georgian Dream party won local elections with more than 80% of the vote. The typically low-key local elections had acquired high stakes after months of raids on independent media, the introduction of laws restricting civil society and the jailing of dozens of opponents and activists.

title: Bad Bunny brings Puerto Rican pride to the Super Bowl amid MAGA backlash
subhed: The Puerto Rican superstar, selected to perform at the halftime show of the American football championship final on February 8, has come under attack from leading figures in the pro-Trump MAGA sphere.

title: If you love Eugène Boudin, you will love Honfleur
subhed: The Impressionist painter has a museum named after him in this popular Normandy tourist town, where he was born. Many other artists have been drawn here by the ever-changing light of the estuary.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhed: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

France's global news agency AFP buckles under pressure from rising populism
subhed: Targeted by several authoritarian governments, Agence France-Presse – one of the three leading global news agencies – has found itself struggling financially in the face of a fragile media sector, changing news consumption habits and the rapid rollout of AI.

title: French PM Lecornu rules out forcing through budget bill
byline: By Denis Cosnard, Mariama Darame and Nathalie Segaunes
subhed: In his first public statement since his appointment, Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu announced that he would not use a contested constitutional provision to force the budget bill through without a vote.

title: Former American diplomat Robert Malley: 'Trump's Gaza plan offers more ambiguities and potential pitfalls than clear answers'
subhed: In an interview with Le Monde, Robert Malley, who participated in peace negotiations between Israel and Palestine under Bill Clinton, Barack Obama and Joe Biden, sees Donald Trump's plan as yet another attempt that fails to take history into account. In particular, he questions the relevance of the two-state solution.
